<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass looks for equivalent functions that are mergable and folds them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Order relation is defined on set of functions. It was made through</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// special function comparison procedure that returns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 0 when functions are equal,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// -1 when Left function is less than right function, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 for opposite case. We need total-ordering, so we need to maintain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// four properties on the functions set:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a &lt;= a (reflexivity)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if a &lt;= b and b &lt;= a then a = b (antisymmetry)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if a &lt;= b and b &lt;= c then a &lt;= c (transitivity).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for all a and b: a &lt;= b or b &lt;= a (totality).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Comparison iterates through each instruction in each basic block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Functions are kept on binary tree. For each new function F we perform</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// lookup in binary tree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In practice it works the following way:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// -- We define Function&#42; container class with custom &quot;operator&lt;&quot; (FunctionPtr).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// -- &quot;FunctionPtr&quot; instances are stored in std::set collection, so every</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    std::set::insert operation will give you result in log(N) time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As an optimization, a hash of the function structure is calculated first, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two functions are only compared if they have the same hash. This hash is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// cheap to compute, and has the property that if function F == G according to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the comparison function, then hash(F) == hash(G). This consistency property</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is critical to ensuring all possible merging opportunities are exploited.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Collisions in the hash affect the speed of the pass but not the correctness</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or determinism of the resulting transformation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When a match is found the functions are folded. If both functions are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// overridable, we move the functionality into a new internal function and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// leave two overridable thunks to it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Future work:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; virtual functions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Many functions have their address taken by the virtual function table for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the object they belong to. However, as long as it&#39;s only used for a lookup</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and call, this is irrelevant, and we&#39;d like to fold such functions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; be smarter about bitcasts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In order to fold functions, we will sometimes add either bitcast instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or bitcast constant expressions. Unfortunately, this can confound further</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// analysis since the two functions differ where one has a bitcast and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// other doesn&#39;t. We should learn to look through bitcasts.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; Compare complex types with pointer types inside.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; Compare cross-reference cases.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; Compare complex expressions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All the three issues above could be described as ability to prove that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// fA == fB == fC == fE == fF == fG in example below:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  void fA() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    fB();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  void fB() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    fA();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  void fE() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    fF();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  void fF() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    fG();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  void fG() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    fE();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Simplest cross-reference case (fA &lt;--&gt; fB) was implemented in previous</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// versions of MergeFunctions, though it presented only in two function pairs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in test-suite (that counts &gt;50k functions)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Though possibility to detect complex cross-referencing (e.g.: A-&gt;B-&gt;C-&gt;D-&gt;A)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// could cover much more cases.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138" lineLink="#a4737afc16f96c5ef910121891806236c"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;unsigned&gt;</a> <a href="#a4737afc16f96c5ef910121891806236c">NumFunctionsForVerificationCheck</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;mergefunc-verify&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/cl/desc">cl::desc</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;How many functions in a module could be used for &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">             </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;MergeFunctions to pass a basic correctness check. &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">             </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;&#39;0&#39; disables this check. Works only with &#39;-debug&#39; key.&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#ac12e6a8f3a1b511f0dee2ed6de0ae806">cl::init</a>(0), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Under option -mergefunc-preserve-debug-info we:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Do not create a new function for a thunk.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Retain the debug info for a thunk&#39;s parameters (and associated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   instructions for the debug info) from the entry block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   Note: -debug will display the algorithm at work.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Create debug-info for the call (to the shared implementation) made by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   a thunk and its return value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Erase the rest of the function, retaining the (minimally sized) entry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   block to create a thunk.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Preserve a thunk&#39;s call site to point to the thunk even when both occur</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   within the same translation unit, to aid debugability. Note that this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   behaviour differs from the underlying -mergefunc implementation which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   modifies the thunk&#39;s call site to point to the shared implementation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   when both occur within the same translation unit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160" lineLink="#a7fabdcd96db5d30230cac856fcc0f890"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a7fabdcd96db5d30230cac856fcc0f890">MergeFunctionsPDI</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;mergefunc-preserve-debug-info&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Replace G with an alias to F if possible, or a thunk to F if possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns false if neither is the case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> writeThunkOrAlias(Function &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, Function &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ad96b7cf3182ce2ba85e5a7a93b12c441">G</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Replace function F with function G in the function tree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> replaceFunctionInTree(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FunctionNode &amp;FN, Function &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ad96b7cf3182ce2ba85e5a7a93b12c441">G</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The set of all distinct functions. Use the insert() and remove() methods</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to modify it. The map allows efficient lookup and deferring of Functions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlight">  FnTreeType FnTree;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Map functions to the iterators of the FunctionNode which contains them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the FnTree. This must be updated carefully whenever the FnTree is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// modified, i.e. in insert(), remove(), and replaceFunctionInTree(), to avoid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dangling iterators into FnTree. The invariant that preserves this is that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there is exactly one mapping F -&gt; FN for each FunctionNode FN in FnTree.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">  DenseMap&lt;AssertingVH&lt;Function&gt;, FnTreeType::iterator&gt; FNodesInTree;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!WorklistBB.empty()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We are interested in the following instructions from the entry block as being</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// related to parameter debug info:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - @llvm.dbg.declare</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - stores from the incoming parameters to locations on the stack-frame</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - allocas that create these locations on the stack-frame</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - @llvm.dbg.value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - the entry block&#39;s terminator</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Copy all metadata of a specific kind from one function to another.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743" lineLink="#ad1818449dffd5cc3789f152aec4f3b9b"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#ad1818449dffd5cc3789f152aec4f3b9b">copyMetadataIfPresent</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;From, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42;To,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MDNode &#42;, 4&gt;</a> MDs;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><span class="doxyHighlight">  From-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalobject/#aef569d822dbf572ae71954d6831ce8a9">getMetadata</a>(Kind, MDs);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> &#42;MD : MDs)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><span class="doxyHighlight">    To-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalobject/#aa1b0638c63ba711320b3bb9c69367ed6">addMetadata</a>(Kind, &#42;MD);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Replace G with a simple tail call to bitcast(F). Also (unless</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// MergeFunctionsPDI holds) replace direct uses of G with bitcast(F),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// delete G. Under MergeFunctionsPDI, we use G itself for creating</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the thunk as we preserve the debug info (and associated instructions)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// from G&#39;s entry block pertaining to G&#39;s incoming arguments which are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// passed on as corresponding arguments in the call that G makes to F.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For better debugability, under MergeFunctionsPDI, we do not modify G&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// call sites to point to F even when within the same translation unit.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1019"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FunctionNode &amp;OldF = &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/ms-demangle/#afb795990ffc0cb7321e7d1eacc246324a8eea62084ca7e541d918e823422bd82e">Result</a>.first;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1020"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1021"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="#af82ad926e8835a16d12da44d98a70490">isFuncOrderCorrect</a>(OldF.getFunc(), NewFunction)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1022"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Swap the two functions.</span></CodeLine>
